channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Massive NPM Supply Chain Attack Spreads Self-Replicating "Shai-Hulud" Worm
item.description:
A significant, ongoing supply chain attack is targeting the NPM JavaScript ecosystem, where a self-replicating worm dubbed "Shai-Hulud" has infected over 400 software packages. The attack has a substantial impact on the cryptocurrency sector, compromising at least 10 widely used libraries crucial fo...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: FCC Rolls Back ISP Cybersecurity Rules Despite China-Linked Hacking Threats
item.description:
In a controversial decision, the U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has rescinded cybersecurity regulations for internet service providers (ISPs). These rules were implemented by the Biden Administration following the discovery that the Chinese state-sponsored hacking group Salt Typhoon ha...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Gang Hits LG Energy Solution, Claims 1.7TB Data Theft
item.description:
South Korean battery manufacturing giant LG Energy Solution has confirmed it was the victim of a ransomware attack at one of its overseas facilities. The notorious Akira ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for the breach, alleging on its dark web leak site that it stole 1.7 terabytes of data ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: New "Autumn Dragon" Espionage Campaign Targets Southeast Asia
item.description:
A newly identified cyber-espionage campaign named "Autumn Dragon" has been targeting government and media organizations across Southeast Asia since early 2025. The operation, attributed with medium confidence to a China-nexus Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, aims to gather intelligence relate...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShadowPad Backdoor Deployed via Critical WSUS Server Vulnerability
item.description:
An active intrusion campaign is exploiting a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). Attackers, believed to be Chinese state-sponsored APTs, are leveraging the flaw to gain system-level access and deploy the sophistica...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Supply Chain Breaches Escalate Despite Maturing Defenses, Report Finds
item.description:
A new 2025 report from cybersecurity firm BlueVoyant reveals a troubling trend: despite most organizations maturing their third-party risk management (TPRM) programs, the number of supply chain breaches is escalating. The study found that 97% of surveyed organizations experienced a supplier-related ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks Peak on Holidays and Weekends, Exploiting Low Staffing
item.description:
A new global study by Semperis, the "2025 Holiday Ransomware Risk Report," confirms that threat actors strategically launch attacks during holidays and weekends to exploit reduced security staffing. The report found that 52% of organizations were targeted during these off-hour periods. Alarmingly, 7...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Ransomware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Italian IT Firm Almaviva Hit by Cyberattack, 2.3TB of Data Leaked
item.description:
The prominent Italian IT services provider Almaviva has confirmed it was hit by a major cyberattack, resulting in the theft and leaking of nearly 2.3 terabytes of sensitive data. The breach has exposed information from several of Almaviva's clients, most notably Italy's national railway operator, Fe...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Harvard University Data Breach Exposes Donor Information After Phone Phishing Attack
item.description:
Harvard University has disclosed a data breach affecting its Alumni Affairs and Development Office, discovered on November 18, 2025. The incident originated from a phone-based phishing (vishing) attack that gave an unauthorized party access to systems containing personal information and donation rec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: Actively Exploited Oracle RCE Flaw Allows Full System Takeover
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Oracle Identity Manager, CVE-2025-61757, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. The flaw, with a CVSS score of 9.8, allows an unauthenticated attacker to ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT24 Group Uses 'BadAudio' Malware in Years-Long Espionage Campaign Targeting Taiwan
item.description:
The Chinese-nexus threat group APT24, also known as Pitty Tiger, is behind a nearly three-year cyberespionage campaign utilizing a new custom malware called 'BadAudio'. According to Google's Threat Intelligence Group, the campaign, active since November 2022, has targeted organizations primarily in ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Major Wall Street Banks Exposed After Breach at Mortgage Vendor SitusAMC
item.description:
SitusAMC, a critical technology and services provider for the real estate finance industry, has disclosed a significant data breach discovered on November 12, 2025. The cyberattack compromised corporate information and, more critically, data belonging to its clients' customers, which could include s...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Grafana Enterprise Hit by Critical 10.0 CVSS Flaw Allowing Admin Impersonation
item.description:
Grafana Labs has patched a critical vulnerability, CVE-2025-41115, in Grafana Enterprise that carries the maximum CVSS score of 10.0. The flaw resides in the SCIM provisioning feature and allows a malicious SCIM client to escalate privileges and impersonate any user, including the default administra...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: CrowdStrike Fires Insider for Leaking Screenshots to 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' Hacking Group
item.description:
Cybersecurity giant CrowdStrike has confirmed it fired an employee last month for acting as a malicious insider. The employee leaked screenshots of internal systems, including an Okta dashboard, to the 'Scattered Lapsus$ Hunters' hacking group, who then posted them on Telegram. CrowdStrike stated th...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Incident Response, Threat Actor, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 10.0 CVSS Flaw in Azure Bastion Allows Full Cloud Takeover
item.description:
Microsoft has patched a critical authentication bypass vulnerability, CVE-2025-49752, in its Azure Bastion service. The flaw, which scores a perfect 10.0 on the CVSS scale, could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to gain administrative control over all virtual machines connected via a vulnera...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShinyHunters Hits Salesforce Again, Breaching Customers via Gainsight App
item.description:
Salesforce has disclosed a significant data breach affecting its customers, stemming from a compromised connection with the Gainsight customer success application. The notorious cybercrime group ShinyHunters, also tracked as UNC6240, has claimed responsibility for the attack, stating they exploited ...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: SEC Abandons Landmark Lawsuit Against SolarWinds and its CISO
item.description:
In a surprising move, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has voluntarily dismissed its civil enforcement action against SolarWinds and its CISO, Timothy G. Brown. The lawsuit, filed in October 2023, had accused the company and Brown of misleading investors about their cybersecurity po...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: SANS Report: OT/ICS Cyber Incidents Rising, 40% Cause Downtime
item.description:
A new report from the SANS Institute highlights a dangerous trend in the security of Operational Technology (OT) and Industrial Control Systems (ICS). The '2025 State of ICS/OT Security Report' found that over 21% of organizations experienced a cyber incident in their OT environment in the past year...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: WEL Companies Investigated for Data Breach Affecting 122,960 People
item.description:
The law firm Schubert Jonckheer & Kolbe LLP is investigating transportation and logistics firm WEL Companies, Inc., following a data breach that compromised the sensitive personal information of 122,960 people. The breach, which exposed names, Social Security numbers, and driver's license numbers, w...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Policy and Compliance
